intro: Saguaster elegans, commonly known as the elegant saguaro, is a flowering plant native to the Sonoran Desert of North America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems that can grow up to 20 meters tall. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by orange-red berries containing seeds. Saguaster elegans is adapted to arid environments, with deep roots that allow it to store water efficiently. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in desert ecosystems.
